commentBody: Estonian wood is certainly good, especially when it costs only $6 per bundle at my local Wegman's in Buffalo. It is probably the same aromatic kiln-dried birch Mr. Easterbrook can pick up in DC for $8-$9 per bundle. It is amazing that that wood can be shipped to inland cities right across from Canada and its 1,000,000 square miles of boreal forest. to sell for $6 for 20 lbs. retail.
